content: topsy turvy cowl material and supplies yarn 1 skein of squishy worsted weight or chunky yarn you may need a bit more depending on the size of your cowl i used vanna s choice mary maxim starlette tweed and premier serenity chunky hook to match yarn i like to use a good-sized hook to maintain the loft of the yarn so i usually go with a j for the worsted aran and an l or higher for the chunky gauge & sizing of your choice i made mine about 20-24 long and about 6 or so high special stitches front post double_crochet fpdc foundation single_crochet fsc if you are not familiar with these stitches there are many tutorials on-line notes cowl is worked in joined but not turned rounds this is a moebius cowl so both the front and the back of the stitches will show that s part of its charm directions set-up make a fsc as long as you want your cowl bring the ends together in a circle give the starting end of your fsc a half twist so that the top of the stitches are facing downward instead of up and join with a slip_stitch round 1 chain 3 double_crochet in next st and in each fsc around note that as you come around to the point opposite your initial join you will automatically change from working in the top of the fsc to working in the bottom of the fsc continue around until you meet up with the beginning join with slip_stitch in top of chain 3 do not turn round 2 chain 3 fpdc around next st and every st around join with slip_stitch in top of chain 3 do not turn subsequent rounds repeat round 2 for desired width of cowl last round chain 1 single_crochet in each stitch around join and end off finishing if there is a hole where you joined your fsc use the yarn tail to sew it up weave in ends and enjoy copyright 2013 rebecca averill tales of the hook
